summary: What about peter having an older sister?
question: What about peter having an older sister?
answer:
• Oh dude peter having an older sister would be sarcasm city.
  • she definitely found out about Spider-Man due to being observant
  • And she’s always having to cover for him when may got suspicious
  • She goes off to college and peter thinks he’s going to have a mental break down because he’s never been anywhere without her
  • But he’s still really protective over her and when she brings her boyfriend home,, ohno
  • Peter would spend half the night glaring at him
  • But in reality he’s just scared he won’t get to spend as much time with his older sister
  • They bicker a lot, like normal siblings
  • When he doesn’t come back from the infinity war she’s absolutely distraught
  • And she wishes that she could have convinced him not to
  • Because it wouldn’t be the first time she’s had to stop him from doing something stupid
  • She has to spend most of the time making sure aunt may is okay but on reality, she needs her baby brother
  • Peter and his older sister = the best duo around

tags: I have no explanation for what this is besides utter crap
body:
It’s a Fairytale

@marvelousgay asked for “fairy Peter like 5 foot nothing and slender and adorable with wings and pointy ears and Tony who’s got feelings for this adorable dude but is like you’re not a fucking fairy you’re just a weirdo and makes Peter prove it somehow?” took it in a slightly different direction, hope you like it nonetheless babes! sorry it took me a few days to get to it, hope you’re feeling better now 💕

Tony leans against the wall, flicking through his phone, cigarette hanging loosely from the fingertips of his unoccupied hand. He ventures a look up, going back to his phone when he fails to spot the shock of chestnut curls he’s looking for. It’s a few minutes later when he hears the chirp of a bright “hi!” in front of him.

He looks up, smile inadvertently tugging at his lips when he sees the beanie, light pink pom-pom hanging off the back only adding to the cuteness of the boy’s cold-flushed cheeks and red tipped nose, bundled adorably in an oversized parka that swallows him whole. “Pete! Finally, ‘m freezing my ass off out here,” he complains, depositing the cigarette in a nearby ashtray.

“Well, maybe if you didn’t wear leather jackets in the winter while it’s snowing, you wouldn’t be cold!” Peter exclaims, cheerful as ever, and Tony chuckles, shaking his head.

“Smartass. C’mon, let’s go.” Tony leads the way to his car, opening Peter’s door for him, resisting the urge to tilt his head and go for the boy’s lips when Peter places a kiss on his cheek in thanks. He shuts the door and jogs around to the other side, rubbing his hands together for warmth after he gets inside and turns on the heater.

Movement catches his attentions, and Tony turns to see Peter pull off his hat, running a hand through his hair, shaking the curls out and the snow off. Tony can’t help himself, reaching out to tug lightly on the ear closest to him. “Always forget how pointy your ears are.”

“Heyyy,” Peter whines, slapping Tony’s hand away. “I told you, all fairies have pointy ears.”

“Jeez, you’re still on that? Fuck, you’re lucky you’re pretty, otherwise you’d be at the bottom of the social ladder. I’d be annihilated for just looking at you.” Tony starts the car, turning over his shoulder to reverse out of the parking space.

Peter rolls his eyes, mouth pursing in distaste. “You humans. So petty.”

Tony chooses not to comment on Peter’s identical nature completely human. They spend the rest of the ride talking about anything and everything, jokes and banter coming quick and easy. Peter makes Tony laugh, Tony makes Peter giggle, and by the time they get home, he forgets all about Peter’s ‘eccentricities’.

They make it home and up to Peter’s room, skipping past the kitchen once they realize no one’s home. They peel off their wet outer layers, Tony with just his leather jacket, Peter with his parka, a light jacket, a hoodie, and a sweater under that.

“Jesus, trynna get a heat stroke in negative ten degree weather?” Tony questions from the corner, laughing.

Peter rounds on him with a pout, putting away his clothes. “We’ve been over this, fairies get colder, quicker. It’s warmer where we live.”

Before Tony can respond, Peter pulls off his last sweater, light pink wings extending out behind his back. “Christ, Pete, you still wear those? You should really give ‘em back to whichever poor little girl you stole them from.”

Peter takes the high road, sticking his tongue out before reaching for his laptop, the two of them beginning their work on their assignment. They research, write, and edit for hours, the sky gradually darkening as they work away. Its hours later when Tony looks up from his computer screen, cracking his neck and stretching his arms.

“Fuck, it’s pretty dark outside, and the snow is still coming down pretty hard. I should go.”

“Oh shit, you’re right.” Peter helps Tony pack up, putting his stuff into his bag while the older boy pulls on his jacket. They walk to the front door together, Peter giving Tony a small peck on his cheek as he walks out of the door, a soft “drive safe” whispered in his ear.

Tony smirks. “Always. ‘Night, sweetheart. Sweet dreams.”

“Text me when you get home!” Peter calls, watching him get into the car and start it up. “Even though I’ll know,” he mutters under his breath, shutting the door.

**

The first thing Tony sees when he manages to crack an eye open is pink. Endless amounts of pink that stretch as far as he can see, mixed in with what look like clouds of white. He sits up, doing a double take when his feet don’t hit solid ground. He looks down, realizes he’s on one of those floating cloud thingies. He looks closer to see what looks like blue grass and purple dirt and what the fuck is happening?!

“Tony! You’re awake!” Tony whips around to see Peter fluttering over to him, pink wings flapping behind him as he hovers a few meters off the ground. Tony blinks a few times, because he doesn’t remember getting high at Peter’s house, and he’s never hallucinated at this level, regardless of whatever drug he’s been on.

“Pete, what the fuck did we take?” It comes out harsher than intended but Tony’s mildly concerned, wants to know how fast this high is going to wear off.

Peter comes closer, cupping Tony’s cheek and running a thumb across the older boy’s cheekbone, eyebrows creased in confusion. “What’re you talking about?”

“Last thing I remember is being at your house, so I’m assuming we took something, which is why I’m high as fuck and hallucinating.”

“Hallucinating what?”

“Oh god, don’t tell me you don’t see it too!” Tony cries, panicking.

“See what, Tony?” Peter looks more and more concerned with each passing minute, watching Tony morph from panicked to borderline hysterical.

“This!” Tony gestures wildly with his hand “The pink sky and the floating cloud and all the fucked up colours and how fucking hot it is.” His eyes widen further when he hears Peter’s airy giggle, confounded that he finds anything about the situation remotely amusing.

“You’re not hallucinating, silly. You got into an accident on the way home and your injuries were too severe, they wouldn’t have been able to save you on Earth. So I brought you here!”

“Okayyyy,” Tony intones, more than mildly concerned now that Peter had taken an even higher dose of whatever they’d had than he had. “And, for conversation’s sake, where exactly is here?”

“Where the fairies are from!”

“Right.” The bright and chipper and slightly manic smile on Peter’s face is ringing all of Tony’s warning bells and he just wants to get out of whatever fucking nightmare he’s having. And then he’s never hanging out with this kid again; honestly, the whole fairy thing should’ve tipped him off.

“Thinking about how long it’s going to take for your high to wear off? When you’re going to wake up in the real world?” Peter questions, breaking Tony’s train of thought.

“No, no, nothing like that. I believe this place is real” – sure he does – “Just wondering when you’re gonna take me home,” Tony finishes with a bright smile, hoping to sound convincing.

“Oh. Well, that’s easy enough to answer. Never!” Peter exclaims, clapping his hands like he’s just delivered the best news in the world.

Christ, this kid has fully lost it. “What do you mean, never?”

“The accident was so scary, I thought I was going to lose you for good,” Peter says seriously, cupping Tony’s face in his hands. “So we’re staying here, where I can keep you safe forever and ever.”

The more time that passes, the more Tony realizes this isn’t a nightmare he’s waking up from.

He looks up, smile inadvertently tugging at his lips when he sees the beanie, light pink pom-pom hanging off the back only adding to the cuteness of the boy’s cold-flushed cheeks and red tipped nose, bundled adorably in an oversized parka that swallows him whole. “Pete! Finally, ‘m freezing my ass off out here,” he complains, depositing the cigarette in a nearby ashtray.

“Well, maybe if you didn’t wear leather jackets in the winter while it’s snowing, you wouldn’t be cold!” Peter exclaims, cheerful as ever, and Tony chuckles, shaking his head.

“Smartass. C’mon, let’s go.” Tony leads the way to his car, opening Peter’s door for him, resisting the urge to tilt his head and go for the boy’s lips when Peter places a kiss on his cheek in thanks. He shuts the door and jogs around to the other side, rubbing his hands together for warmth after he gets inside and turns on the heater.

Movement catches his attentions, and Tony turns to see Peter pull off his hat, running a hand through his hair, shaking the curls out and the snow off. Tony can’t help himself, reaching out to tug lightly on the ear closest to him. “Always forget how pointy your ears are.”

“Heyyy,” Peter whines, slapping Tony’s hand away. “I told you, all fairies have pointy ears.”

“Jeez, you’re still on that? Fuck, you’re lucky you’re pretty, otherwise you’d be at the bottom of the social ladder. I’d be annihilated for just looking at you.” Tony starts the car, turning over his shoulder to reverse out of the parking space.

Peter rolls his eyes, mouth pursing in distaste. “You humans. So petty.”

Tony chooses not to comment on Peter’s identical nature completely human. They spend the rest of the ride talking about anything and everything, jokes and banter coming quick and easy. Peter makes Tony laugh, Tony makes Peter giggle, and by the time they get home, he forgets all about Peter’s ‘eccentricities’.

They make it home and up to Peter’s room, skipping past the kitchen once they realize no one’s home. They peel off their wet outer layers, Tony with just his leather jacket, Peter with his parka, a light jacket, a hoodie, and a sweater under that.

“Jesus, trynna get a heat stroke in negative ten degree weather?” Tony questions from the corner, laughing.

Peter rounds on him with a pout, putting away his clothes. “We’ve been over this, fairies get colder, quicker. It’s warmer where we live.”

Before Tony can respond, Peter pulls off his last sweater, light pink wings extending out behind his back. “Christ, Pete, you still wear those? You should really give ‘em back to whichever poor little girl you stole them from.”

Peter takes the high road, sticking his tongue out before reaching for his laptop, the two of them beginning their work on their assignment. They research, write, and edit for hours, the sky gradually darkening as they work away. Its hours later when Tony looks up from his computer screen, cracking his neck and stretching his arms.

“Fuck, it’s pretty dark outside, and the snow is still coming down pretty hard. I should go.”

“Oh shit, you’re right.” Peter helps Tony pack up, putting his stuff into his bag while the older boy pulls on his jacket. They walk to the front door together, Peter giving Tony a small peck on his cheek as he walks out of the door, a soft “drive safe” whispered in his ear.

Tony smirks. “Always. ‘Night, sweetheart. Sweet dreams.”

“Text me when you get home!” Peter calls, watching him get into the car and start it up. “Even though I’ll know,” he mutters under his breath, shutting the door.

**

The first thing Tony sees when he manages to crack an eye open is pink. Endless amounts of pink that stretch as far as he can see, mixed in with what look like clouds of white. He sits up, doing a double take when his feet don’t hit solid ground. He looks down, realizes he’s on one of those floating cloud thingies. He looks closer to see what looks like blue grass and purple dirt and what the fuck is happening?!

“Tony! You’re awake!” Tony whips around to see Peter fluttering over to him, pink wings flapping behind him as he hovers a few meters off the ground. Tony blinks a few times, because he doesn’t remember getting high at Peter’s house, and he’s never hallucinated at this level, regardless of whatever drug he’s been on.

“Pete, what the fuck did we take?” It comes out harsher than intended but Tony’s mildly concerned, wants to know how fast this high is going to wear off.

Peter comes closer, cupping Tony’s cheek and running a thumb across the older boy’s cheekbone, eyebrows creased in confusion. “What’re you talking about?”

“Last thing I remember is being at your house, so I’m assuming we took something, which is why I’m high as fuck and hallucinating.”

“Hallucinating what?”

“Oh god, don’t tell me you don’t see it too!” Tony cries, panicking.

“See what, Tony?” Peter looks more and more concerned with each passing minute, watching Tony morph from panicked to borderline hysterical.

“This!” Tony gestures wildly with his hand “The pink sky and the floating cloud and all the fucked up colours and how fucking hot it is.” His eyes widen further when he hears Peter’s airy giggle, confounded that he finds anything about the situation remotely amusing.

“You’re not hallucinating, silly. You got into an accident on the way home and your injuries were too severe, they wouldn’t have been able to save you on Earth. So I brought you here!”

“Okayyyy,” Tony intones, more than mildly concerned now that Peter had taken an even higher dose of whatever they’d had than he had. “And, for conversation’s sake, where exactly is here?”

“Where the fairies are from!”

“Right.” The bright and chipper and slightly manic smile on Peter’s face is ringing all of Tony’s warning bells and he just wants to get out of whatever fucking nightmare he’s having. And then he’s never hanging out with this kid again; honestly, the whole fairy thing should’ve tipped him off.

“Thinking about how long it’s going to take for your high to wear off? When you’re going to wake up in the real world?” Peter questions, breaking Tony’s train of thought.

“No, no, nothing like that. I believe this place is real” – sure he does – “Just wondering when you’re gonna take me home,” Tony finishes with a bright smile, hoping to sound convincing.

“Oh. Well, that’s easy enough to answer. Never!” Peter exclaims, clapping his hands like he’s just delivered the best news in the world.

Christ, this kid has fully lost it. “What do you mean, never?”

“The accident was so scary, I thought I was going to lose you for good,” Peter says seriously, cupping Tony’s face in his hands. “So we’re staying here, where I can keep you safe forever and ever.”

The more time that passes, the more Tony realizes this isn’t a nightmare he’s waking up from.

title: photo booth
body:
requested by: @im-shy-artsy

word count: 410

summary: smoochin’ in a photo booth, babey!

           “(y/n), check that out!”

           “What is it, Peter?” you ask, trying to look where he pointed.

           Before you could spot it, he had grabbed your wrist and dragged you to it. It was an old photo booth, the kind to spit out a column of photos when you were done. You doubted it worked, but as Peter pulled back the curtain to sit inside, you saw the screen was on.

           “Want to give it a go?” said Peter, grinning at you from the small space.

           “Fuck it,” you say, climbing inside. “Let’s give her a shot!”

           He smiled at you, your legs almost flush against his in the booth. It was smaller on the inside. His heart was racing, and as he watched you press the buttons and toss in a few quarters, he hatched a small plan. His palms sweat at the thought, but he steeled his thoughts.

           You sat back, and felt Peter sling his arm around your shoulder. You raised an eyebrow at him but didn’t complain. A little heat rose to your cheeks. He probably just did it for the photos.

           As the booth counts down to the first photo, you smile brightly. The booth screen flashes, and the next countdown appears. 5 seconds. You feel Peter tug at your shoulder, and you lean onto his, still smiling. You close your eyes, and the next photo is taken.

           You sit up, and as you open your eyes you see a flash of skin. Peter reached his free arm towards your face, tilting you gently towards him. His eyes flitted around your face, and as he leaned towards you the booth took a photo.

           When your lips met his, you closed your eyes again. Your hand found its way into his hair, and you leaned into the kiss. Peter’s lips were soft, and he tasted vaguely of the soft pretzel you had shared minutes ago. The booth took it’s last photo and began talking loudly.

           You pulled away, startled, then looked back at Peter. He looked a little hurt with a small, sad smile on his face.

           “Was that not okay?” he asked.

           You grabbed his hand and gave it a squeeze.

           “That was more than okay,” you said, smiling.

           “Can we do it again?”

           “I think I’m out of quarters.”

           “No,” Peter laughs. “I meant…”

           He kissed you again, and you kissed him back. The photos hung, momentarily forgotten as you melted into each other again.

summary: What if Peter and the others are stuck in some kind of limbo and Peter finds a way to communicate with Tony - only Tony thinks...
body:
What if Peter and the others are stuck in some kind of limbo and Peter finds a way to communicate with Tony - only Tony thinks he’s losing his mind and screams for the voice to go away. Peter persists for a time but one day falls silent and Tony ends up begging through his tears to hear him again.

The father-son dynamic will end me I swear.

summary: Summary: Peter Parker had made the direst mistake of his life. He would never forgive himself for this. He had called Mr. Stark...
body:
Summary:

Peter Parker had made the direst mistake of his life. He would never forgive himself for this. He had called Mr. Stark Dad. Peter blamed Ned. Not only did Ned keep calling Mr. Stark his father but he had made a playlist dedicated to father and son songs that he would play whenever Peter was around. He had gone so far as to hack Karen to play the playlist whenever Peter got near Mr. Stark.
Now he was standing in the compound after more or less baring in bouncing and ranting about how he had won the science fair. Too late he realised he had started that sentence with “Dad”. And in classic Peter Parker luck Tony wasn’t even alone. Mr. Rhodes was there, currently looking as a kid who got the news that Christmas came early. Peter wanted to die

Fic under the cut or at ao3

Peter Parker had made the direst mistake of his life. He would never forgive himself for this. He had called Mr. Stark Dad. Peter blamed Ned. Not only did Ned keep calling Mr. Stark his father but he had made a playlist dedicated to father and son songs that he would play whenever Peter was around. He had gone so far as to hack Karen to play the playlist whenever Peter got near Mr. Stark.

Now he was standing in the compound after more or less baring in bouncing and ranting about how he had won the science fair. Too late he realised he had started that sentence with “Dad”. And in classic Peter Parker luck Tony wasn’t even alone. Mr. Rhodes was there, currently looking as a kid who got the news that Christmas came early. Peter wanted to die.

“I uh, I got to go. I mean I forgot I had somewhere to be. I’m gonna… I have to. I mean. Bye.” Peter ran out of the building to Mr. Rhodes laughter and Mr Starks shocked expression.

Next thing he did was to call Ned. “Ned I will kill you. I will kill you painfully and slowly. You won’t see it coming.”

“What have I done?”

“You’ve singlehandedly ruined my life. Oh god I have to move. I’m gonna move to Canada, change my name, live underground.”

“Peter you have to breathe, whatever I did I will fix it. Is this about telling MJ you like her? Because I swear it was a mistake.”

“No this is not about that – wait you did what?”

“Oh, never mind that. I’m sure she likes you back anyway. But back to the topic at hand. What. Did. I. Do?”

“I called Mr. Stark Dad.”

“Only that? You had me scared there, Peter.”

“Are you listening to me? I called Mr. Stark Dad. I’m gonna die. He’s gonna kill me.”

“I highly doubt that. And how is this my fault anyway?”

“The playlists? The father comments? Changing Mr. Stark’s contact name in my phone to IronDad.”

“Oh, that.”

“Yeah, that.”

“Well how did he react?”

“He didn’t react at all, he just stared at me. And War Machine was there too, and he laughed. He laughed. God, I’m so screwed.”

When Peter and Ned finally hung up it was near midnight and Peter made his way home. He curled up in his bed and grieved the unavoidable loss of another parental figure.

As Peter had expected he didn’t hear from Mr. Stark all week. He guessed his days in the lab with him was over. Peter cursed himself for ruining everything. He was probably just some guilt case and now he had scared Mr. Stark away because he was incapable of controlling his emotions. He walked out of the school on Friday, wondering what excuse he would make up to May for not going to the compound over the weekend like usual, only to find Happy waiting for him in the parking lot. Peter had never been more relived and confused in his life. But he got in the car without saying anything and found a great happiness that Happy didn’t treat him any different. At least he wouldn’t lose him.

He got so caught up on talking to Happy he forgot to be nervous about meeting Mr. Stark again. When he got to the compound though, Mr. Stark didn’t treat him any different. They sat there working on their separate stuff and just when Peter thought that maybe, maybe they could just brush Peter’s mistake aside and never talk about him again Mr. Stark spoke up.

“Peter, about what you said on Monday –“

“We don’t have to talk about it. We really, really don’t have to talk about it. I’m sorry, it won’t happen again, I promise -.”

“- you do know I love you right?”

“- again, I’m sorry and you know what I’ll just leave”

“Pete, did you hear what I said? I love you. I don’t mind you calling me dad. I really don’t. I mean the amount of times I’ve called you my kid in front of Rhodey is quite frankly embarrassing.”

“Oh, it is.” Mr. Rhodes suddenly turned up. “At this point I’m surprised he hasn’t applied for adoption.”

“Rhodey!”

“You know Peter, after you ran out of the building after calling Tony Dad, he cried. I have never seen him so happy. Well, until he started panicking about you not meaning it and it being a mistake. It took three hours to calm him down and then he called Pepper about it to panic some more.”

Peter stared at Mr. Rhodes completely floored. This had to be a joke. It was a joke.

“Come on you two, hug already. You know you want to.”

“Uh”

Mr. Stark spread his arms. “Come here, son.”

And Peter gratefully stepped in to his arms.

Peter stared at Mr. Rhodes completely floored. This had to be a joke. It was a joke.

“Come on you two, hug already. You know you want to.”
